subject: Investing
title: Liquidity Risk in Bonds
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Liquidity Risk in Bonds.

hook.text: You want to sell a corporate bond today. There are no buyers. You drop the price 3% before someone bites.

buildup.text: Liquidity risk is the danger of not finding a buyer at a fair price when you need to sell.

discovery.text: US Treasuries are the most liquid bonds on Earth. Obscure corporate bonds might trade only a few times per week.

twist.text: In a crisis, even liquid bonds become illiquid. Spreads widen and market makers step back just when you need them.

climax.text: In March 2020, even the US Treasury market seized up briefly. The Fed had to intervene to restore order.

punchline.text: Liquidity feels guaranteed until you actually need it.

quiz.question: Which type of bond is generally the most liquid?
